page.title: 01OUR AREA- INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area we have surveyed lies three miles to the south of the City of Wakefield. Here the landscape changes as we leave the city and enter a more rural area. Here we leave the housing estates behind us and enter an area composed of fields,woodland and villages. Much of the area is farmland and there is little real industry. The north of the area is almost entirely covered by housing since this is part of the suburbs of Wakefield.A huge council estate sits on the north westcorner of the area whilst to the north west new, high cost housing has sprung up around what were isolated hamlets and villages. The south of the area is regarded locally as an area of beauty. The most noticeable part of this is the Newmillerdam Country Park.
